channel.title: Green Ruby
channel.description: Green Ruby News is a feed of fresh links of the week about ruby, javascript, webdev, devops, collected by mose every sunday

item.title: Green Ruby News #001
item.description:
# How is it going with Remote Meetups?
It's been a while that you have logged in our Slack Channel. I would like to just to say how we are going and the latest updates!
Doing a Remote Meetup is a little bit difficult, because users report don't have the same feeling as a real meetup. For this reason, We were looking for some tools for helping us to do that. Here, a big thanks to Carlisia Campos and William Kennedy, [GoBridge][1] in general, people from our Go branch who have found a Nice tool: [BigMarker][2].
BigMarker is a paid tool, we got a sponsorship from [Hired.com][3] which helped us to pay this Main Channel for Remote Meetup. [Channel is here!][4] Using this, the attendees interaction will be better. If you want, you can subscribe to this channel and get the latest meetups! We have a paid account up to 100 users.
Go Branch got a sponsorship from Compose.io, which helped them to pay [their own channel][5]. It means, all the Remote Meetups from Go will be centralised in a single channel and not the Main Channel. BTW, if you want to learn Go, it's time! A lot of awesome upcoming meetups in the next weeks!
## Helping Meetups around the World
Another idea we got on-the-fly was helping meetups. We are partner of two Meetups around the world: ParisRb - the biggest meetup in Europe. Green Ruby - A cool meetup in Taipei, Taiwan! These meetups can use or channel and livestream their meetups.
## Elm Remote Meetup
[DailyDrip][6] is [planning][7] to create a Elm Remote Meetup. We are also partner with DailyDrip. They will be using our Channel and using Remote Meetup to do that!
[1]: http://golangbridge.org [2]: https://www.bigmarker.com [3]: https://www.hired.com [4]: https://www.bigmarker.com/remote-meetup [5]: https://www.bigmarker.com/remote-meetup-go [6]: https://www.dailydrip.com/ [7]: https://www.dailydrip.com/blog/organizing-a-remote-meetup-for-elm
